title: 114_hr2405
content: The "Facilitating Investments in Local Markets Act" or the "FILM Act" extends special expensing rules for certain film and television productions, as well as special expensing for live theatrical productions. The "FILM Act" extends expensing rules for film, television, and live theatrical productions until December 31, 2016. The "FILM Act" extends expensing rules for film, television, and live theatrical productions until December 31, 2016, with clerical amendments made to the related sections. The "FILM Act" extends expensing rules for film, television, and live theatrical productions until December 31, 2016, with amendments made to related sections. Section 181 of the Code is amended to include a definition of a qualified live theatrical production, where 75 percent of total compensation must be qualified compensation. The paragraph discusses the eligibility criteria for live staged productions of plays derived from written books or scripts, produced by taxable entities in venues with an audience capacity of not more than 3,000. It also mentions provisions for touring companies with multiple live staged productions. The eligibility criteria for live staged productions of plays derived from written books or scripts produced by taxable entities in venues with an audience capacity of not more than 3,000 include separate simultaneous stagings in different geographical locations treated as separate productions. Each phase of a qualified live theatrical production is considered a separate activity for tax purposes. The amendments made by this section apply to live theatrical productions starting after December 31, 2014, with the first public performance for a paying audience marking the commencement date.
